stories.text:
How would you approach raising a pre-seed round in the current market downturn when investors are mostly focused on managing their existing protfolio instead of expanding it?

Some common advice that I hear: - run your startup as cheaply as possible - plan for a longer runway - be willing to lower your valuation

What else?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to approach raising a pre-seed round in a downturn?
